page.title: 19BERWICK POND AREA
page.content:
Berwick Pond was once part of a river. The surrounding part of Berwick Pond is mainly marshland. The Ingrebourne River is a tributary to the Thames and flows in a southwesterly direction through our area. Berwick Pond supports a lot of wild life. For instance we saw a Heron, a water rat, some baby ducks. The fish that are in Berwick Pond are Roach, Tench, Pike, Perch and Carp. Cattle graze on the fields nearby. The end of Albyn Farm backs on to this area. There are many snakes in the Berwick Pond area.
by pupils from ST. ALBANS SCHOOL
